meanings.definition: The quality of being easily calmed or pacified.
meanings.sent1: Her placability was evident as she quickly calmed down after the argument.
meanings.sent2: The dog's placability made it a favorite among the children in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: Despite his grumpy appearance, his placability shone through when offered a treat.
meanings.sent4: The placability of the ocean waves soothed her troubled mind.
meanings.sent5: The placability of the baby's cries indicated a sense of contentment.

meanings.definition: The ability to be appeased or soothed.
meanings.sent1: The placability of the situation allowed for a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent2: His placability in accepting feedback made him a valuable team player.
meanings.sent3: The placability of the cat surprised everyone when it willingly took a bath.
meanings.sent4: The placability of the music eased the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: Her placability in the face of adversity inspired those around her.
